definition: to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
variant of 攀[pan1]
to pull/to turn (sth) around/to turn around (a situation)/to recoup
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
to recover some lost ground (in a competition)

sentences.english: Young man, learn a few strokes, draw capital on the line.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子，学几招后，扳回本钱就行了。

sentences.english: He lost the second game, but broke back and won the third game.
sentences.chinese: 他失去第二局，可是又扳回一局赢了第三局。

sentences.english: But our number one recovered in the second set to level the match and take it into a decider .
sentences.chinese: 但我们的头号选手扳回了第二盘，将比赛带入决胜盘。

sentences.english: She browsed through the rack of leotards and then pulled one out.
sentences.chinese: 她浏览，通过在机架上的紧身衣，然后扳回一。

sentences.english: Vincenzo Iaquinta pulled a goal back for the visitors from the penalty spot after he had been fouled by Gattuso.
sentences.chinese: 亚昆塔之后利用点球扳回一城，对他犯规的是加图索。

sentences.english: For the Hungarian side Tokoli scored in the 57th minute.
sentences.chinese: 匈牙利联赛联队在第57分钟时由托科利扳回一球。

definition: to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
score
to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to reverse (the score)/to pull off a comeback/to take the lead
to arrest/to capture/to seize/to win (a set, a game etc)
match point (tennis etc)
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
lost game/losing battle
to take precedence
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to lead/to be in front
to turn back/to reverse
victorious/to win/to triumph
inferior/disadvantaged
